Topic.Title: amzn should be down easy 8 bucks tomoro

Message.Msg: Amzn is one of the most manipulated internet sales stocks ever to come to the trading platform. No earnings\a true kindle White hype currently being blasted and bragged about everywhere you listen and unless this kindle hype does not pan out to be a huge success, this stock will be economic suicide to short. I know it doesn't make sense, but if libraries and schools are replacing their books with electronic paper and it is less expensive and more in vogue to buy kindle books, we have a new brave world to deal with and big brother, the market maker and money managers who have unlimited resources are going to change the way we read and buy. God help us if they come up with an electronic stylus that will let writers and students interact with the traditional written word; The book as we know it will become obsolete. Sad but welcome to the brave new world and the end of literature as we knew it; Like film it will sounding a death knoll. A very dangerous stock to short when the cards are stacked up against you.

Message.Title: HKTV last $6.23 with $18 Analyst Target (ASIA STOCK)
Message.Msg: HKTV = NFLX Asia HKTV or Hong Kong Television is launching IPTV in Asia with the Netflix Business Model. Production has already started on several TV Series and PPV Events. The stock closed Friday at $6.23 and has an Analyst Estimate of $18.00 per share this year. I will bet that that year end price projection doubles easily with the News after Friday's close. There is also a China Stock Group calling for a $50 target on HKTV that also came out after Friday's close. This is The China Netflix with a MASSIVE MARKET. Just the mobile market alone is staggering when factoring the music side is added in the mix. There once was a time not to long ago when Analysts said that mobile users would not have any impact on those users having any significant impact on eCommerce as for movies, music, travel, or shopping for goods or services. It is fast becoming the standard. I love the innovation of the convergence of online and mobile. I love even more Markets that have BILLIONS of Users that are in a Region with 14% Growth year after year.

Message.Msg: Dont expect much today in regards a drop. The big funds will want to show Amazon ownership at the end of the quarter since it has done so well this year. Message.Title: PSDV (MC $90 M) FDA Decision on OCTOBER 17 // LOW FLOAT 11 M SHRS = 300%++Potential !!
Message.Msg: This Low Float Rocket will hit $6++ before FDA decision on October 17 ...PSDV will move into double digits easily with FDA approval for Blockbuster Candidate Iluven .There is NO FDA approved drugs for DME (Diabetic Macular Edema) . Upon US approval of Iluvien, pSivida would be entitled to receive a $25 million milestone payment from Alimera and 20 percent of net profits, as defined, on sales of the drug by Alimera. DME is a potentially blinding disease that affects over one million people in the United States. Currently there are no FDA approved drugs for the treatment of DME.The U.S. market for DME is $1.5 billion to $4 billion. Pfizer is third largest Shareholder of PSDV holding 1.9 M Shares . PSDV is very close to profitability . Psivida (PSDV) Market Cap: $90 M Cash: $21 M Price: $4 Shares Out: 26.8 M ( 10.4 M shares held by Insiders & Institutions) “We are very pleased that the FDA has accepted Alimera Sciences’ recently resubmitted New Drug Application for ILUVIEN® for chronic Diabetic Macular Edema (DME) and has set a PDUFA target date of October 17, 2013." Upon US approval of Iluvien, pSivida would be entitled to receive a $25 million milestone payment from Alimera and 20 percent of net profits, as defined, on sales of the drug by Alimera. The injectable, sustained release micro-insert ILUVIEN® for the treatment of chronic DME considered insufficiently responsive to available therapies, licensed to Alimera Sciences, Inc., has received marketing authorization in Austria, France, Germany, Portugal, Spain and the U.K. and is awaiting authorization in Italy. -

Topic.Title: If a tree falls in the woods ...

Message.Msg: tech is a very smart guy but much like many of us that have been stubborn and gotten burnt shorting this stock or buying puts, he has difficulty accepting it as a trading scam to the upside. The market is now full of many of these jam scam pain trades. Best to let them run their course and mostly stay away. I do agree with him that it's pretty obvious that many of these have been gamed up and I also agree that it's mostly not good for the market. I don't find it hard to believe that he would be involved with a few companies. Have you ever read any of Paulo Santos articles on SA or Timothy Phillips? They are both brilliant guys and as Paulo essentially states his financial predictions have been correct but the stock keeps going up. Timothy was a CFO or COO in 1 or 2 companies Silicon Valley I believe. They both sing off the same song sheet about this company's financials. They don't pretend to be great stock traders by any stretch but they just discuss what they see on the balance sheet. What will change to make the fundamentals finally matter here? That is the billion dollar question. Also will the fundamentals finally turn around to the positive? I have respect for tech because it's pretty apparent that he's a smart guy. He, like many of us, is certainly not a great trader by any stretch, nor am I, that's for sure but I'm a pretty good long term investor and I generally believe that fundamentals usually win out but this may be a forever exception to the rule. Now sybs, I had enough of him for quite sometime. As you have always stated since I first came to this board, 100% fraud. He's on ignore along with that weirdo geegee. Continued success for you Nas because I think you sincerely call a spade a spade and I respect that even if we disagree on them sometimes.
